Class PieceManager

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.logic.PieceManager
public class PieceManager extends Object
Manages the active falling brick, including its movement, rotation, spawning of new bricks, and interaction with the game board. It acts as an intermediary between the game logic and individual brick operations.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    PieceManager(GameBoard gameBoard)
    Constructs a new PieceManager, associating it with a specific GameBoard.

  • Constructor Details

    • PieceManager

      public PieceManager(GameBoard gameBoard)
      Constructs a new PieceManager, associating it with a specific GameBoard. Initializes the brick generator and rotator.
      Parameters:
      gameBoard - The GameBoard instance this PieceManager will operate on.

  • Method Details

    • moveDown

      public boolean moveDown()
      Attempts to move the active brick down by one unit. Checks for collisions with the game board or other blocks.
      Returns:
      True if the brick successfully moved down, false if a collision prevented the move.

    • moveLeft

      public boolean moveLeft()
      Attempts to move the active brick left by one unit. Checks for collisions with the game board or other blocks.
      Returns:
      True if the brick successfully moved left, false if a collision prevented the move.

    • moveRight

      public boolean moveRight()
      Attempts to move the active brick right by one unit. Checks for collisions with the game board or other blocks.
      Returns:
      True if the brick successfully moved right, false if a collision prevented the move.

    • rotateLeft

      public boolean rotateLeft()
      Attempts to rotate the active brick to the left. Checks for collisions after rotation.
      Returns:
      True if the brick successfully rotated, false if a collision prevented the rotation.

    • spawnNewBrick

      public boolean spawnNewBrick()
      Spawns a new brick at the designated spawn point. Sets the new brick as the active brick and checks for immediate collision, which would indicate a game over state.
      Returns:
      True if the newly spawned brick immediately collides, indicating game over.

    • getViewData

      public ViewData getViewData()
      Gathers and returns all necessary data for rendering the game view. This includes the current brick's shape and position, the next brick's shape, and the ghost piece's position.
      Returns:
      A ViewData object containing comprehensive information for display.

    • mergeBrickToBackground

      public void mergeBrickToBackground()
      Merges the current active brick into the game board's background. This is typically called when the brick has landed and can no longer move.
